details.Chief Justice: Hon'ble The Chief Justice Saraswati Vishnu Kosandar

Cases.name: Criminal Cases
Cases.description: Criminal cases are the ones where a person is accused of committing a crime and is being tried in court.

Cases.name: Civil Cases
Cases.description: Civil cases are the ones where two or more parties are involved in a dispute and are trying to resolve it through the courts.

Writ Petitions.name: Habeas Corpus Writ Petition
Writ Petitions.description: A writ petition is a type of court petition that is used to challenge the legality or constitutionality of a law or government action.

Administrative Tribunals.name: Karnataka Administrative Tribunal
Administrative Tribunals.description: The Karnataka Administrative Tribunal is a quasi-judicial body that hears appeals against decisions made by government agencies.

Administrative Tribunals.name: Central Administrative Tribunal
Administrative Tribunals.description: The Central Administrative Tribunal is a quasi-judicial body that hears appeals against decisions made by central government agencies.

Other.name: Tax/Excise Cases
Other.description: Cases related to tax and excise, including appeals and disputes over tax assessments or exemptions.

Other.name: Motor Vehicle Cases
Other.description: Cases related to motor vehicles, including accidents, insurance claims, and disputes over vehicle ownership or registration.

details.re-designation: The High Court of Karnataka hereby re-designate the following officers as the State Public Information Officer and the First Appellate Authority.
officers: Principal Bench High Court - (Protocol and Establishment Hospitality)
